pageContext.claim: “Making matters worse, the [JCPOA] deal's inspection provisions lack adequate mechanisms to prevent, detect, and punish cheating, and don't even have the unqualified right to inspect many important locations, including military facilities.”
pageContext.analysis: Iran had to dismantle its nuclear program significantly as part of the JCPOA. Iran also gave the international community wide access to investigate its nuclear activities. Some critics of the JCPOA argue that the key is access to military sites, which the JCPOA did not grant.
